functionalj.stream

Interface StreamPlusWithCombine<DATA>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RegExMatchResultStream, StreamPlus<DATA>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayBackedStreamPlus

    public interface StreamPlusWithCombine<DATA>

    • Method Detail

      • streamPlus

        StreamPlus<DATA> streamPlus()

      • prependWith

        default StreamPlus<DATA> prependWith(Stream<DATA> head)
        Concatenate the given head stream in front of this stream.

      • appendWith

        default StreamPlus<DATA> appendWith(Stream<DATA> tail)
        Concatenate the given tail stream to this stream.

      • mergeWith

        default StreamPlus<DATA> mergeWith(Stream<DATA> anotherStream)
        Merge this with another stream by alternatively picking value from the each stream. If one stream ended before another one, the rest of the value will be appended. For an example: <br> This stream: [A, B, C] <br> Another stream: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] <br> Result stream: [A, 1, B, 2, C, 3, 4, 5] <br>

      • zipWith

        default <ANOTHER> StreamPlus<Tuple2<DATA,ANOTHER>> zipWith(Stream<ANOTHER> anotherStream)
        Combine this stream with another stream into a stream of tuple pair. The combination stops when any of the stream ended. For an example: <br> This stream: [A, B, C] <br> Another stream: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] <br> Result stream: [(A, 1), (B, 2), (C, 3)] <br>

      • zipWith

        default <ANOTHER> StreamPlus<Tuple2<DATA,ANOTHER>> zipWith(Stream<ANOTHER> anotherStream,
                                                           ZipWithOption option)
        Combine this stream with another stream into a stream of tuple pair. Depending on the given ZipWithOption, the combination may ended when one ended or continue with null as value. For an example with ZipWithOption.AllowUnpaired: <br> This stream: [A, B, C] <br> Another stream: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] <br> Result stream: [(A, 1), (B, 2), (C, 3), (null, 4), (null, 5)] <br>

      • zipWith

        default <ANOTHER,TARGET> StreamPlus<TARGET> zipWith(Stream<ANOTHER> anotherStream,
                                                    BiFunction<DATA,ANOTHER,TARGET> combinator)
        Combine this stream with another stream using the combinator to create the result value one by one. The combination stops when any of the stream ended. For an example: <br> This stream: [A, B, C] <br> Another stream: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] <br> Combinator: (v1,v2) -> v1 + "-" + v2 Result stream: [A-1, B-2, C-3] <br>

      • zipWith

        default <ANOTHER,TARGET> StreamPlus<TARGET> zipWith(Stream<ANOTHER> anotherStream,
                                                    ZipWithOption option,
                                                    BiFunction<DATA,ANOTHER,TARGET> combinator)
        Combine this stream with another stream using the combinator to create the result value one by one. Depending on the given ZipWithOption, the combination may ended when one ended or continue with null as value. For an example with ZipWithOption.AllowUnpaired: <br> This stream: [A, B, C] <br> Another stream: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] <br> Combinator: (v1,v2) -> v1 + "-" + v2 Result stream: [A-1, B-2, C-3, null-4, null-5] <br>

      • choose

        default StreamPlus<DATA> choose(Stream<DATA> anotherStream,
                                BiFunction<DATA,DATA,Boolean> selectThisNotAnother)
        Create a new stream by choosing value from each stream using the selector. The value from the longer stream is automatically used after the shorter stream ended. For an example: <br> This stream: [10, 1, 9, 2] <br> Another stream: [ 5, 5, 5, 5, 5, 5, 5] <br> Selector: (v1,v2) -> v1 > v2 <br> Result stream: [10, 5, 9, 5]

      • choose

        default StreamPlus<DATA> choose(Stream<DATA> anotherStream,
                                ZipWithOption option,
                                BiFunction<DATA,DATA,Boolean> selectThisNotAnother)
        Create a new stream by choosing value from each stream using the selector. The value from the longer stream is automatically used after the shorter stream ended. For an example: <br> This stream: [10, 1, 9, 2] <br> Another stream: [ 5, 5, 5, 5, 5, 5, 5] <br> Selector: (v1,v2) -> v1 > v2 <br> Result stream: [10, 5, 9, 5]
